fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-18029].
  {panel}

Congratulations on delivering a wonderful improvement to the Office connector plugin with Confluence 3.1. I really enjoy the new features and no bugs yet :-)

However, on the Word/Powerpoint page rendering one issue that still makes life difficult is the incomplete rendering/display support for Word/Powerpoint documents containing Text Boxes. 

In 1.6 it shows the text within the boxes at least but its mostly all left justified and there are no box outlines, or Word autoshapes or graphic objects such as box join lines or arrows displayed.

Above: think a flowchart done in Word with text boxes and arrows - thats what I'm trying to display in rendered in a Confluence page.

I know the above can be done in Gliffy or embedded as a JPG in the word doc but we have 1000's of Word and Powerpoint documents containing text box content and converting them will take a long time, and in some cases such as ISO 9000 documents we always want to store everything in the Word document since there is (as yet, hint, hint!) no way to export pages from Confluence (e.g. PDF export) with headers, footers, proper pagination, etc suitable for such "controlled" documents.

This missing Word/Powerpoint text box support from the Office connector is restricting further application of Confluence in our business. Please consider this feature request ASAP.
fields.summary: Word/Powerpoint text box and autoshapes support still lacking from Office connector page rendering in Confluence 3.1
Maintain Cursor Position When Drafts are Autosaved

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-18017].
  {panel}

This was raised by a customer on twitter:

_#Confluence 3.1 would be even better if Atlassian called the installation types "Evaluation" (not standard) and "Production" (not custom)._ - http://twitter.com/movito/status/6474148211

I asked where this language was and this was the response:

_@ConfluenceGuru Hey there! On the installer page, right below where you enter your license details. T'would be great to have that fixed._ - http://twitter.com/movito/status/6490946974
fields.summary: Language used to describe installation types in Confluence Installer is inconsistent our recommendations in docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-18003].
  {panel}

* Use the Windows Evaluator, and go to the 'Choose Components' screen
* Position the mouse over the component 'Confluence Core'

The description given is currently "Confluence Evaluation 3.1"

This is simply repeating what the user already knows - we should provide a better description of the product in this space.
fields.summary: Windows Evaluator: Wizard should provide a better description of what is installed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17987].
  {panel}

    * Go to a Space containing attachments
    * Select 'Browse' -> 'Attachments'

Expected: The user should be able to sort the list by any of the columns.

Current: All columns are sortable except for 'Creator' and 'Attached To'.
fields.summary: Browse: Attachments: Should allow sorting by 'Creator' and 'Attached To' columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17985].
  {panel}

* Go to a Space containing attachments
* Select 'Browse' -> 'Attachments'
* Enter 'doc*' into the 'File Extension' filter.


Expected: This should return a list of all the attachments with extension '.doc' and '.docx'.

Current: No matches are returned. This means that to find all doc files, the user must first search for 'doc' and then repeat the search for 'docx'.
fields.summary: Browse: Attachments: Filter by extension should allow wildcard matching
Link webdav instructions

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce 

0) Ensure you have hooked up your install to mysql
1) Create a user 
2) Let that user create a comment in a page
3) Let that user edit that comment and save 
4) Log in as admin and try to remove the user created at 1)

This will fail on:

{code:xml}
            spaces.add(comment.getPage().getSpace());
{code}

in com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateSpaceDao#mySqlGetSpacesContainingCommentsByUser

as 

comment.getPage() will be null for the original comment (i.e. the comment that was edited). 

Database:
||CONTENTID||CONTENTTYPE||TITLE||VERSION||CREATOR||CREATIONDATE||LASTMODIFIER||LASTMODDATE||VERSIONCOMMENT||PREVVER||CONTENT_STATUS||SPACEID||PARENTID||MESSAGEID||PAGEID||PARENTCOMMENTID||USERNAME||DRAFTPAGEID||DRAFTSPACEKEY||DRAFTTYPE||DRAFTPAGEVERSION||CHILD_POSITION||
|23592962|'COMMENT'|(null)|2|'partha'|'2009-12-04 15:33:42'|'partha'|'2009-12-04 15:33:55'|''|(null)|'current'|(null)|(null)|(null)|23396354|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|
|23592963|'COMMENT'|(null)|1|'partha'|'2009-12-04 15:33:42'|'partha'|'2009-12-04 15:33:42'|''|23592962|'current'|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|(null)|

Notice that the pageid for the editted comment is null. 

We should either set the pageid for comments that are edited, which won't help for comments that have already been edited, or we simply assume that comments with no page, are old comments and skip them.
fields.summary: NPE when removing a user which has created a comment that has been edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17959].
  {panel}

1) Log in to Confluence.
2) Click "Add New Page".
3) Type some content into the editor.
4) Wait for the session to time out (or in terms of user scenarios, wait until your computer goes to sleep or take it somewhere without network connectivity).
This can be simulated by opening another browser window and logging out of Confluence there.
5) Return to the initial browser window and click "Save".

An Ognl exception is thrown, a "System Error" page is displayed, and any user data entered since the last draft save is lost.

Similar exceptions can occur when doing other operations that submit data to the server via POST, as raised in CONF-17891, CONF-7993.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17952].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Create a new page and click on "Macro browser" to add a gadget.

Result:
1. Currently the tab having all gadget listing is named as "External Contents" which is not very use friendly and can confuse user only.
2. In the confluence any way we have concept of macros and now gadgets are also there, adding a third term is not very useful.

Expected:
1. The "External Contents" tab should be renamed to something more associated with gadgets.
fields.summary: Gadget tab in confluence macro browser dialog should be renamed to be more consistent with other Atlassian product and gadget terminology .
removePermissionsFromSpace addition to Remote API
Allow comment to be collapse-able by the root comment
Allow normal users to know which group(s) they belong to
It should be a requirement that names listed in Plugin Repository for particular plugins be the same name as what shows up on the plugins screen
Improve Macro Markup Rendering in the RTE
OAuth access token are revoked after 7 days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17908].
  {panel}

In Confluence 3.1, there are now two ways a user can create pages directly from the dashboard:

* via the normal 'Add Page' buttons next to every space in the space list
* via the new 'Add Page' button at the top-right of the dashboard.

The default parent page when creating a page via these links is the "space root", not the home page of the space. If the user doesn't explicitly set a parent page, the new page will be lost at the top of the space, not discoverable via the navigation sidebar or page tree in the default home page layout.

The default parent for pages created from the dashboard should be the space home page.
fields.summary: Set the space home page as default parent page when a page is created directly from the dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17819].
  {panel}

In CONF-17151, it was established that if a page contains more than 32 CSS imports, IE will randomly drop CSS files and/or JavaScript includes, causing random and difficult-to-debug failures.

The implemented fix batched up the CSS imports for the bundled plugins, reducing the number of import statements, but is not a permanent solution to the problem.

We should have a test that asserts that the default number of CSS imports on any given Confluence page is less than a defined number (possibly around 20, which gives buffer room for 3rd-party plugins to include their own). Thus, a few years down the track when we all forget and the number of CSS imports creeps up again, we'll see a test failure before we start seeing random JavaScript errors in IE.

Created as a separate issue from CONF-17151, as writing the automated test is a lower priority task that shouldn't delay the release process.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17574].
  {panel}

Any java written application which interfaces with Confluence as a client, via the SOAP and/or XML/RPC interface, because they are themselves their own JVM, maintain a list of 'clean' and 'dirty', references to objects which the client knows about, across the wire.

When a remote client of Confluence calls a regular System.gc() as a part of it's usual automated garbage collection routine, it will notify the remote peer (in this case, Confluence), that any objects it was holding, of which Confluence was tracking in it's own reference object graph, are now dirty and those references should be cleaned.

Currently the Hotspot JVM performs this action as a serial, single-threaded System garbage collection. This can lead to rare circumstances whereby a remote client, if poorly written, or resource starved in the JVM, can fatally spam Confluence with full system GC calls until (if) it recovers.

The effect is similar to:
{noformat}378.030: [GC [PSYoungGen: 13733K->10886K(418816K)] 257769K->254922K(1336320K), 0.0438305 secs] [Times: user=0.05 sys=0.00, real=0.05 secs] 
378.074: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 10886K->0K(418816K)] [ParOldGen: 244036K->244138K(917504K)] 254922K->244138K(1336320K) [PSPermGen: 66190K->66190K(135168K)], 1.5175107 secs] [Times: user=4.92 sys=0.05, real=1.51 secs] 
379.924: [GC [PSYoungGen: 15258K->712K(435328K)] 259396K->244850K(1352832K), 0.0091928 secs] [Times: user=0.00 sys=0.00, real=0.02 secs] 
379.933: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 712K->0K(435328K)] [ParOldGen: 244138K->240486K(917504K)] 244850K->240486K(1352832K) [PSPermGen: 66592K->66590K(131072K)], 1.6306610 secs] [Times: user=4.53 sys=0.00, real=1.63 secs] 
382.535: [GC [PSYoungGen: 19106K->11462K(431104K)] 259592K->251948K(1348608K), 0.0230824 secs] [Times: user=0.06 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] 
382.558: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 11462K->0K(431104K)] [ParOldGen: 240486K->240176K(917504K)] 251948K->240176K(1348608K) [PSPermGen: 66648K->66646K(131072K)], 1.3173999 secs] [Times: user=4.14 sys=0.00, real=1.31 secs] 
383.926: [GC [PSYoungGen: 12066K->5636K(446080K)] 252242K->245812K(1363584K), 0.0219822 secs] [Times: user=0.05 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] 
383.949: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 5636K->0K(446080K)] [ParOldGen: 240176K->245655K(917504K)] 245812K->245655K(1363584K) [PSPermGen: 66668K->66668K(131072K)], 1.2802751 secs] [Times: user=4.03 sys=0.00, real=1.27 secs] 
385.301: [GC [PSYoungGen: 7271K->224K(441408K)] 252926K->245879K(1358912K), 0.0217929 secs] [Times: user=0.03 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] {noformat}
Rendering the installation incapacitated.

From [Sun|http://java.sun.com/javase/technologies/hotspot/gc/gc_tuning_6.html#other_considerations]:

{quote}Another way applications can interact with garbage collection is by invoking full garbage collections explicitly by calling System.gc(). This can force a major collection to be done when it may not be necessary (i.e., when a minor collection would suffice), and so in general should be avoided. The performance impact of explicit garbage collections can be measured by disabling them using the flag -XX:+DisableExplicitGC, which causes the VM to ignore calls to System.gc().

One of the most commonly encountered uses of explicit garbage collection occurs with RMI's distributed garbage collection (DGC). Applications using RMI refer to objects in other virtual machines. Garbage cannot be collected in these distributed applications without occasionally collection the local heap, so RMI forces full collections periodically. {quote}Alternatively,{quote}The frequency of these collections can be controlled with properties. For example,

	 java -Dsun.rmi.dgc.client.gcInterval=3600000 -Dsun.rmi.dgc.server.gcInterval=3600000 ...
 
specifies explicit collection once per hour instead of the default rate of once per minute. However, this may also cause some objects to take much longer to be reclaimed. These properties can be set as high as Long.MAX_VALUE to make the time between explicit collections effectively infinite, if there is no desire for an upper bound on the timeliness of DGC activity.{quote}

Originates from [CSP-38789|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-38789]. Explicit remote GC can be completely disabled (ignored) via {{-XX:+DisableExplicitGC}} in Tomcat startup parameters, under Sun Hotspot. Recommend we add this to the distribution startup parameters. Ignoring client requests for GC should not have any impact moving forward as Confluence has already been notified that the object is dirty, or dereferenced, and will reclaim it as part of normal collections.
fields.summary: disable distributed garbage collection via RMI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17557].
  {panel}

There are a few consistency problems that would be good to fix in the new Gadget Directory before we ship it.

- The wording 'Click here for ...' is against our conventions for link text in Confluence. We don't say 'Click here', rather the link text should be a description of what is found at the destination of the link. Change this to something like 'Confluence Gadget Documentation'.
- The text 'Click here for ...' is too large. It should be the same size as the text above it.
- There is a hover background colour on the gadget specs, but they aren't clickable. You should only use hover highlighting when the target is clickable.
- The description for the Activity Stream says, 'Lists recent activity in a single project, or in all projects.', but we don't have projects in Confluence. Should it say 'space'/'spaces' instead?
- The gadget thumbnails are scaled down here like in the macro browser when they don't need to be. (I presume they're scaled down. If they're not, we need to recreate those images because they look badly scaled.)

Some improvement ideas:

- Make the text 'By Atlassian' and 'Gadget URL' smaller (or greyer, or both) so that the title and description are more obvious. The latter are the important pieces of information, so they should stand out a bit more.
- Make the font for the description text in the left panel the same size as the body font on the right-hand side.
- Put some short introductory text in the dialog. Either above the 'How to use these gadgets' on the left, or in a panel above the gadgets on the right. It should explain what gadgets are: 'Gadgets allow you to display Confluence content and information in other applications.'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17513].
  {panel}

New  PDF export functionality in 3.0 allows for a single title page within a given space, however, this does not seem sufficient.

We generally store content which feeds multiple "publishable documents" within a single space within Confluence, where a "publishable document" is a set of pages that I would want to export as a PDF, and have its own cover page, etc. 

For each "publishable document", it should therefore be possible to define the following:

* Its own title page (or possibly use to a header page "template", where it would then only be necessary to specify 1 or 2 variables for this specific document - such as title and version)
* Its own header
* Its own footer
* The specific set of pages (or pagetree) that should be published for this document

A "non-privileged" user should be able to define these title pages (as opposed to a space administrator).

Further comments related to this improvement request are listed here listed here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KIHjCg
fields.summary: PDF Export should allow for more than one title page, and more than one "publishable documents" from a given space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17509].
  {panel}

We don't yet have concrete data to detail exactly how much heap is consumed. However, we are certain that after the introduction of change documents in 3.0, the index has grown significantly larger (in terms of the total number of lucene documents). 

At minimum the no. of docs would have at least doubled, given that we do generate a change doc for the latest version of each piece of content on the system. 

Given that:

# field caches are arrays that are sized proportional to the document size of the index
# and the BitSet's used in all Lucene filtering operations are also sized proportional to the document size of the index

We are looking at higher memory consumption because we are allocating much larger arrays and BitSets, and filling them only very sparsely.
fields.summary: Reduce the memory/heap consumption of lucene filtering operations and field caches
Trivial icon placement bug

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17495].
  {panel}

The client site is down and they are not able to use their wiki.

Immediatley after starting confluence it is throwing a cluster panic on a single node install ... see attached log.

NB: the reference to builder before the panic is due to the fact that the plugin has been DISABLED to ensure that it is NOT the cause of the problem.

I have applied the patch found here: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-17136

fields.summary: Cluster panics immediatley on startup with PATCHED confluence 3.0.2
Add a quick-access history to all pages
Sort favourite pages in the favpages macro by title, add time,...
Provide mechanism to get more than the first 10 results from a search in the page move dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17460].
  {panel}

Improve the thread dump process so:

* it can be passed by a thread dump analyser
* Prints a timestamp before doing the dump, so we know the exact time it is dumped. 
* Automatically prints a thread dump before sending support request or creating support zip. 

Nice to have 
* Automatically shows in the Administration > Thread dump page (expandable for each thread) for when the user wants to debug live.  

Example:

!http://img.skitch.com/20091104-r1g2s47duqtwpui4p7ck6umyjx.jpg!
fields.summary: Improve the thread dump output
profile-tabs.xml using non-standard context items

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-17446].
  {panel}

When using WebDav I cannot navigate to all of the pages. I can navigate down a few levels, but cannot reach pages stored below that level. For example in our doc43 space I can navigate to the Reference Guide page, but not to the Client Browser page.

This is important as we need to make a large number of changes to the pages because the Word imported inserted hundreds (perhaps thousands) of spurious anchors.

Thanks,
Larry
fields.summary: Cannot see all pages when using WebDav
